Message.Title: Boeing and the Milk Industry
Message.Msg: Exorbitant (subcontracting costs) feed(parts) costs and lower( discounts ,late delivery fee’s massive ,rework overtime labor costs , in the USA to fix the 787 problems) are just the same as the milk prices and huge number of milk producers going bankrupt now . . The Midwest drought has led to corn and soybean costs(outsourcing costs) increasing by more than 50 percent this summer(Boeing since day one on the 787), stressing dairymen(Boeing share price down on the year about 5% compared with the Dow up 10%) from Wisconsin and Minnesota to Missouri( Boeing share price down all over the world). But in California(Washington State and Carolina) milk prices(787 production costs are excessive) have also lagged behind( so no profits on the 787 will ever be made) those in the rest of the nation, exacerbating the crisis. And while milk revenues in California have soared to over $7.5 billion in 2011, making milk the top agricultural commodity, higher revenues mean little, famers say, because it costs so much more to produce the milk.Just like production of the 787 is so high the Boeing shareholder and company is losing money and within 5 years Boeing will be bankrupt. "I don't think there's a milk producer in the state who is profitable right now," said Michael Marsh, CEO of Western United Dairymen. Boeing can claim a profit margin of 5.7% but that is Boeing figure like the story that the 787 would be ready and instead was 4 years late and at least 20 billion over budget.

Message.Title: Boeing Managment has compressed the learning curve
Message.Msg: Boeing management warned it might move future work out of the region if it can't keep down the cost of engineers. Congratulations Boeing management team, you have compressed your learning curve If Boeing management has become more efficient at anything, it's in its ability to compress the amount of time it takes to repeat colossal mistakes in judgment..Boeing Executive Leadership has unsuccessfully "been there, done that" with the 787, and everyone felt the pain including workers, mgmt, and shareholders. Attention, attention Chicago Management Team, question for you, . How is threatening people who did their best to fix your 787 mismanagement outsourcing failure, showing them you want to work with them? If the executives raises and pensions and bonuses were the same % as Boeing workers ...then Chicago Management would be walking the talk. Unfortunately the shareholders and the world know that the executive team got huge raises losing as much as 32 billion on a program( outsourcing the 787)...yet they complain about the people that design and build being greedy, for doing their best to fix the 787 a plane that will never work at any rate, too much is wrong with it because it was taken outside Boeing for design and engineering to work as planned by the dreamers in Chicago. How does a man who was in charge of post it’s and a failed GE engine man become the CEO of a airframe making enterprise, Lew Platt, what were you thinking? It also shows not only Boeing executives greed but the stupidity. The outsourced the engineering and build of the 787 to such a great failure? What a joke on the Chicago mismanagement team,....only when they brought the failed work back or had IAM workers fix it on the line, did Boeing workers with great difficulty make as good a fix as we could for this failed 787 disaster. BTW we all know in the shop and the engineering floor that the 787 plane will never be right , it was outsourced too far and taken in the wrong direction for too long with the wrong companies to ever make right. The 787 massive over cost and late fee guarantee that the plane will never make a dime, and when the customers realize they cannot move them around like boxcars and bump into ramps and that they will not show damage like aluminum planes and take huge costs to keep flying, these planes will be parked all around the world on the tarmac. Aluminum dents carbon fiber cracks and then shatters like the tail on a Airbust all at once it is gone, same thing for a 787. No dent to see, but major damage and while flying poof it is gone like a comet airplane built before the technology was ready, the windows were all wrong with the comet, and the 787 everything is wrong. The sad thing about the 787 airplane is that the only Boeing designed and assembled part of the 787 is the Boeing emblem. Remember if it’s not Boeing I am not going? Remember, the outsourced 787 is a imposter Boeing plane. No other Boeing plane was 4 years late and at least 20 billion over budget, figure it out or not, but remember one thing, never fly on a 787 outsourcer(the 787 is not a Boeing made or designed plane) it is a hobbled together mismanagement idea of failure a” Chicagodreamfailure” , very risky. We did our best to fix the chicago nightmare plane but it was too far gone to make right.

"" "" Wrong, they are using 2008 turnout data, not any perceived demographic shift It is no conspiracy theory at all. The polling methodology is public information. And you show me someone who thinks the democrat advantage will be larger than 2008 and I will show you a someone that cuts and pastes from liberal blog sites and presents it like it is credible information. Now let's use the 2010 turnout data and see what the polls say? LOL!! Not fair you say? And you would be correct. But the actual turnout by affiliation will be somewhere right in between 2008 and 2010. Oh and do keep in mind, Rasmussen was in fact the most accurate in 2008 so they are much more likely to be doing something right, wouldn't you say?
